Row.Text: Dojo
+15 XP for all Units. +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in the City. Units trained here gain the Way of the Warrior promotion, granting them +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dojo)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dojo is a Japanese term which literally means "place of the way". Initially, dojos were adjunct to temples.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the Western World, the term dojo primarily refers to a training place specifically for Japanese martial arts such as aikido, judo, karate, or samurai; in Japan, any physical training facility, including professional wrestling schools, may be called dojo because of its close martial arts roots. The term can also refer to a formal training place for any of the Japanese arts ending in "do", meaning "way".

The Dojo is the Japanese unique building, replacing the barracks. It provides unit experience, city science, and a unique promotion that gives extra combat strength to Japan's units. Dojos can significantly advance your military capabilities.
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
